quotation: the united states geological survey said the earthquake had a magnitude of 8.9, and occurred at about 230 miles northeast of tokyo and at a revised depth of about 17 miles, the american agency said. the japanese meteorological agency said the quake had a magnitude of 8.8. news reports said it ranked among the biggest in a century. tsunami waves swept away houses and cars in northern japan and pushed ships aground. trains were shut down across central and northern japan, including tokyo, and air travel was severely disrupted. the government held an emergency session to coordinate response as the death toll rose to 23 in five prefectures, officials said. at least 30 people were injured in the cities of tokyo and osaka.
